page.title: 04BURNHAM HARBOUR - RECREATION
page.content: The Harbour at Burnham Overy Staithe and the surrounding marshes and banks form an area well loved by sailors, birdwatchers and wildfowlers alike. The sailors are primarily dinghy users sailing within the Estuary around the high tide, for apart from the channel of the{River Burn}the Harbour dries out to sand and mud at low tide. The Overy Staithe Sailing Club organises racing in the Harbour, and the Regatta Committee organises the Annual Regatta, well known along the coast. Wildfowling is organised by the Burnham Norton and Overy Wildfowlers Association, many members of which are holders of Rights of Common in the area.
